Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were used to express wild-type and mutant LRRK2 proteins.

Readout description.Result Description: The Y1699C variant showed increased interaction with Rab10 compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Interaction intensity within 20% of wild-type LRRK2.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Interaction intensity exceeding 50% of wild-type LRRK2.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with wild-type and mutant LRRK2 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: The Y1699C variant showed increased phosphorylation of Rab10 compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels within 20% of wild-type LRRK2.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels exceeding 50% of wild-type LRRK2.
